Package hu.bme.mit.theta.analysis.algorithm

Class PorLts<S extends State,A extends Action,T>

java.lang.Object
hu.bme.mit.theta.analysis.algorithm.PorLts<S,A,T>
Type Parameters:
S - the type of the state
A - the type of the action (transition in the state space)
T - the type of the transition in the original formalism
All Implemented Interfaces:
LTS<S,A>
Direct Known Subclasses:
XcfaPorLts
public abstract class PorLts<S extends State,A extends Action,T> extends Object implements LTS<S,A>
LTS with a POR (Partial Order Reduction) algorithm applied as a filter when returning enabled actions.

    protected final Set<T>
    backwardTransitions
    Backward transitions in the transition system (a transition of a loop).

    • calculatePersistentSet

      protected Collection<A> calculatePersistentSet(Collection<A> enabledActions, A firstAction)
      Calculates a persistent set of enabled actions starting from a particular action.
      Parameters:
      enabledActions - the enabled actions in the present state
      firstAction - the action who will be added to the persistent set as the first action
      Returns:
      the persistent set of enabled actions

      protected abstract Collection<A> getAllEnabledActionsFor(S state)
      Returns all the enabled actions in a state.

      Returns:
      the enabled actions in the state

    • getPersistentSetFirstActions

      protected Collection<A> getPersistentSetFirstActions(Collection<A> allEnabledActions)
      Returns the actions from where persistent sets will be calculated (a subset of the given enabled actions). The default implementation returns all enabled actions.
      Parameters:
      allEnabledActions - all the enabled actions in the present state
      Returns:
      the actions from where persistent sets will be calculated

    • areDependents

      protected boolean areDependents(A persistentSetAction, A action)
      Determines whether an action is dependent with another one (based on the notions introduced for the POR algorithm) already in the persistent set.
      Parameters:
      persistentSetAction - the action in the persistent set
      action - the other action (not in the persistent set)
      Returns:
      true, if the two actions are dependent in the context of persistent sets

    • canEnOrDisableEachOther

      protected abstract boolean canEnOrDisableEachOther(A action1, A action2)
      Determines whether two actions can enable or disable each other (if true, the two actions are dependent).
      Parameters:
      action1 - action 1
      action2 - action 2
      Returns:
      true, if the two actions can enable or disable each other

      Determines whether the given action is a backward action.
      Parameters:
      action - the action to be classified as backward action or non-backward action
      Returns:
      true, if the action is a backward action

    • getInfluencedSharedObjects

      protected Set<? extends Decl<? extends Type>> getInfluencedSharedObjects(T transition)
      Returns the shared objects (~global variables) used by the given transition or by transitions that are reachable via the given transition ("influenced shared objects").
      Parameters:
      transition - whose successor transitions' shared objects are to be returned.
      Returns:
      the set of influenced shared objects

    • getSharedObjectsWithBFS

      protected Set<? extends Decl<? extends Type>> getSharedObjectsWithBFS(T startTransition, Predicate<T> visitTransition)
      Returns shared objects (~global variables) encountered in a search starting from a given transition.
      Parameters:
      startTransition - the start point (transition) of the search
      visitTransition - the predicate that tells whether a transition has to be explored
      Returns:
      the set of encountered shared objects
